page.title: 01General
page.content: The section is split 50/50 rural and urban with a preponderance of Local Authority housing-semi-detached, terraced and some flats, maisonettes and old people's bungalows in the urban area. Recent private residential building has occurred. Part of the urban section includes much of the town's commercial area with a controversial pedestrainised shopping zone. Education establishments cater for nursery through to further education.The axed Barry Teacher Training College in 189 may soon be demolished to privide private housing against much opposition. Christian churches although prevalent reflect a former popular allegiance. Health, welfare, leisure and transport facilities are adequate. The rural areas include farming, afforestation and recreation.
